questions.question_text: Which component scans for threats in allowed traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Security profiles (C) are the components that scan for threats in allowed traffic, providing essential protection by applying various security checks and controls.
Security Profiles are not used in the match criteria of a traffic flow. The Security Profile is applied to scan traffic after the application or category is allowed by the Security policy rule.

questions.question_text: Which two deployment modes of VM-Series firewalls are supported across NSX-T? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Edit the IP address of all of the affected VMs.
choices.D: Send the VLAN out of the virtual environment into a hardware Palo Alto Networks firewall in Layer 3 mode. Use the same IP address as the old default gateway, then delete it.
choices.B: Create a new virtual switch and use the VM-Series firewall to separate virtual switches using virtual wire mode. Then move the guests that require more security into the new virtual switch.
choices.C: Create a Layer 3 interface in the same subnet as the VMs and then configure proxy Address Resolution Protocol (ARP).

questions.question_text:
A customer in a VMware ESXi environment wants to add a VM-Series firewall and partition an existing group of virtual machines (VMs) in the same subnet into two groups. One group requires no additional security, but the second group requires substantially more security.
How can this partition be accomplished without editing the IP addresses or the default gateways of any of the guest VMs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is how it is explained in beacon content

Selected Answer: B
B is the best way. This is kind of what virtual switches were actually made for. Same VLAN-IDs but different broadcast domains.

choices.B: It must use a Layer 3 underlay network.
choices.D: It must be identified as a default gateway.
choices.A: It must be deployed as a member of a device cluster.
choices.C: It must receive all forwarding lookups from the network controller.

questions.question_text: How must a Palo Alto Networks Next-Generation Firewall (NGFW) be configured in order to secure traffic in a Cisco ACI environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I agree with artic...
both work on software firewalls, EDLs are not available on CN series (yet?)
This could be both B and D. both answers seem correct but D seems more alligned with the goals of the exam (and the features of the VMs, CNs and CNGFW)

questions.question_text: Which component allows the flexibility to add network resources but does not require making changes to existing policies and rules?
